H0.text: Who was the executioner of Louis XVI. Charles Henri Sanson's brother, Henri Sanson

H1.text: Who was the executioner of Louis XVI. Georges Danton

H2.text: Who was the executioner of Louis XVI. Maximilien Robespierre

H3.text: Who was the executioner of Louis XVI. Sansom

A4.text: Sanson was the executioner of Louis XVI.

A5.text: Sanson and his men executed Danton.

A6.text: The execution by guillotine was performed by Charles-Henri Sanson, then High Executioner of the French First Republic and previously royal executioner under Louis.

A7.text: Charles-Henri Sanson testified that Louis XVI had bravely met his fate.

A8.text: Towards the end of the Terror in 1794, revolutionary leaders such as Georges Danton, Saint-Just and Maximilien Robespierre were sent to the guillotine.
